iati-activity.title: Support to EAC Partnership Fund

iati-activity.description: Support to an INGO, that supports conflict prevention, crises management and peace building in Africa.
iati-activity.sector: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Regional Coordination. The purpose of the Regional Coordination Programme is to improve the project personnel network in East Africa. Fidaâs partners with several churches in East Africa and has a large variety of different types of development projects with them. In the past_ all individual projects worked separately. In order to create synergy and enhance the work in general_ Fida is now moving towards thinking in terms of East Africa as a whole. The key function of the programme is to provide a platform for the partners to network with each other and to ensure they share the Fida vision and strategies. The programme also works as a monitoring and planning channel to provide expertise in e.g. such thematic areas as HIV/AIDS and gender_ and to supervise the use of material and human resources. Training on ethics as well as financial administration are also part of the programme. As the partners are brought together_ they will be able share experiences and begin new partnerships. This will lead towards the formation of a well-functioning network that implements high quality holistic development work.

location.name: Ethiopia_ Uganda_ Tanzania_ Kenya_ Sudan_ (if nec. DR Congo_ Malawi_ Rwanda_ Burundi)

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: HIV and AIDS Mainstreaming Programme. The purpose of the programme is to increase HIV/AIDS mainstreaming and competence of local partners. In East Africa Fida partners with mainly churches. The HIV/AIDS Mainstreaming Programme is a direct result of the partnersâ own call for assistance as they wished to make a stronger impact on local HIV/AIDS affected communities. The programme offers the partners capacity-building and support in formulating HIV/AIDS intervention policies. The partnersâ already existing development projects provide an opportunity for practical learning through HIV/AIDS related activities. Through the programme_ the partnersâ competence in HIV/AIDS work improves and_ at the same time_ the local communities become more aware of the phenomenon. This type of development will contribute to the strengthening of the overall response to HIV/AIDS in the communities.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Gender Mainstreaming and Advocacy Project. The purpose of the project is to improve gender mainstreaming and competence within projects and local partner organizations. Fida is working with national churches in Ethiopia_ Kenya_ Tanzania_ Uganda and Sudan. The partnersâ competence is raised and gender mainstreaming advocated through awareness-raising and training of trainers. Also monitoring already existing projects in terms of gender is part of the process. The partners are involved at all levels: from the preparation of materials to planning and implementation at the local level. As the competence and understanding among the partners on gender related questions builds up_ they will be increasingly able to apply their learning in practice. Gender becomes an integral part of all project planning_ implementation and monitoring. This will lead towards the increase of gender equality in the local communities in which the churches work.

iati-activity.title: SADC Gene Bank
iati-activity.description: Support to SADC Plant Genetic Resources Centre' and the network of National Plant Genetic Resources Centres of the SADC member countries in order to preserve and enable the utilization of the plant genetic resources of the region.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (SASK)
iati-activity.description: The quickly expanding economic relations between China and Africa raise several questions and worries for which the African trade union movement is seeking answers and models. Already at the end of 2006, a group of African union leaders asked a regional research network to conduct an extensive study into Chinese investments, in order to gain information on the nature, sectors, economic and social impacts, and employment terms of these investments.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (SASK)
iati-activity.description: The projectâs main goal is to strengthen the project countriesâ unions through increased membership, member capacity, negotiation and democratic operating models. Regional collaboration between the project countries helps to share information and experiences on many levels. One example is the support provided by the relatively strong Ghana and Nigeria for Liberia and Sierra Leone, which are recovering from war and building up from ruins.

location.name: Angola, Ghana, Kenya, Malawi, Namibia, Nigeria, South Africa, Tanzania, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Burkina F

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (SASK)
iati-activity.description: The overall objective is to implement practical and strategic union responses to contract and agency labour problems in Sub-Saharan Africa.

location.name: Botswana, Democratic Republic of Congo, CÃ´te d'Ivoire, Mali, Tanzania, Zambia, Zimbabwe

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (SASK)
iati-activity.description: The cultivation of flowers, mainly for the European market, is expanding rapidly in African countries. It employs hundreds of thousands of people, especially young women, and provides poor countries with much-needed export revenues. The costs are the increasing environmental risks and social problems, which are addressed with more efficient control and certification systems. The project is in its pilot phase, during which studies will be carried out in each project country to provide information on the special conditions of each country and each union. Once the baseline studies are finished, a decision can be made on the most efficient way for the unions to influence the conditions in flower plantations.

location.name: Benin, Burkina Faso, CÃ´te d'Ivoire, Guinea (Conakry), Ghana, Liberia, Mali, Niger, Sierra Leone, Tog

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Plan Finland)
iati-activity.description: Supporting the African Movement of Working Children and Youth (AMWCY). To realize rights of WCY through capacity building_ strengthening coalitions at the national level_ improving governance and monitoring_ increasing networking_ improving lobbying and by contributing to positive long-lasting changes in practices and policies undertaken by the authorities;

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Plan Finland)
iati-activity.description: Supporting the Involvement of Children and Young People in Continued Efforts to end VAC. To ensure a broad dissemination of child and youth friendly materials of the VAC study in print and audio and to strengthen the capacity of a minimum of 200 children engaged in children and youth organizations to advocate against VAC and to engage with the follow-up mechanisms for the VAC Study.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Pelastakaa lapset)
iati-activity.description: Changing and protecting the lives of children in Eastern-Africa. The purpose of the project is that community based and child friendly child protection systems are in place in Kenya (whole country) and in Ethiopia and Somaliland in SCF intervention areas by the end of the project. This is achieved through 1) development in co-operation with relevant duty-berers a disaggregated data collection and monitoring systems on the situation of children and scale and nature of violence_ abuse and exploitation_ 2) establishment of standardized procedures on how to handle child abuse cases_ 3) supportin the duty-bearers to give psychosocial_ legal and medical support in Kenya to children who have been abused and children with special needs_ 4) increse of participation in decision making process of children_ including children with special needs_ 5) improvement of policies_ legislations and implementation structures and systems to be responsive to child abuse at national and regional levels_ and 6) decrease in cultural and traditional values and practices that do not promote child protection.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Pelastakaa lapset)
iati-activity.description: East-Africa: Creating capacity on child rights programming. The purpose of the project is that the quality of SCF EA and it_s partners to react on child right violations has improved. This is achieved through 1) establishment of qualified and committed staff and strong partnerships in SC-F Eastern Africa Regional Programme_ 2) high quality partner selection established and implementation of quality project planning process_ 3)increase in collaboration and networking among regional stakeholders_ including children_ on child rights issues_ 4) improvment of good documentation of Regional Programme activities and existence of relevant ICT materials for advocacy_ training and fundraising purposes.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Pelastakaa lapset)
iati-activity.description: East-Africa: Quality Iclusive Basic Education. The purpose of the project is that children_ including the vulnerable and marginalized receive equitable and quality child friendly basic education in target areas. This is achieved through 1) capacity building of duty bearers to positively influence implementation of inclusive education policies_ 2) increasing community awareness and participation on children_s inclusive education and 3) supporting child friendly learning environment.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Churches United Against HIV and AIDS in Southern and Eastern Africa
iati-activity.description: CUAHA is a wide faith-based network programme focusing especially on capacity-building of programme partners working with and for people who are infected with or affected by HIV and AIDS, and for promoting treatment, prevention, support and care. Programme partners in Afrcica are 37 churches and other FBO; Anglican, Catholic, Evengelical Lutheran, Methodist, Orthodox and Pentecostal. The aim of CUAHA is to encourage and assist partners to work together in collaboration with other actors (NGOs, govermental organisations) on HIV/AIDS response at all levels.

iati-activity.description: Administrative cost of MFA central administration for SOUTH OF SAHARA_ REGIONAL. Costs generated from the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in Helsinki

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finnish Red Cross)
iati-activity.description: Community Based Health and Organizational Development . To build capacity in five national societies to prepare for and respond to major public health emergencies.

iati-activity.title: Drafting of Uranium mining policy and Development of Minerals Database
iati-activity.description: Support for Drafting of Uranium Mining and Milling Policy, Legislation and Regulations and Development of Minerals Database, NAMUPOL.

iati-activity.title: Policy Framework for Investment - PFI
iati-activity.description: Project aims to improve Southern Africaâs investment climate through an integrated programme of Investment Policy Reviews (IPRs), peer learning and experience sharing on the basis of these reviews at the regional level, and finally measurement of results. IPRs will use the Policy Framework for Investment (PFI) as a tool for improving the civil service capacity to design investment policy. They will be carried out by the OECD Secretariat and country teams led by investment policy makers and will engage numerous government agencies involved in developing investment policy. Other stakeholders include business and labour representatives and non-governmental organisations (NGOs) as well as donor agencies active in the field of private sector development and investment promotion.

iati-activity.title: Cooperation in meteorology
iati-activity.description: The cooperation in meteorology is a part of the Finnish thematic cooperation in Southern Africa to promote ecologically sustainable development. The purpose of cooperation in meteorology is based on the regional meteorology priorities for 2009/10 set by the SADC ministers responsible for Transport and Meteorology. The objective is to stregthen the implementation of meteorology services in Southern Africa by building capacity and to make the function of early warning systems more effective.

iati-activity.title: Analytical multi-donor trust fund for Zimbabwe
iati-activity.description: The Objective of the Analytical Multi Donor Trust Fund is to contribute to knowledge on key development challenges facing Zimbabwe, and enable Government and Donors to respond quickly to changes in conditions for economic recovery. Improved donor coordination is an expected benefit from the activities and synergies supported under the A-MDTF. The outputs to be delivered are: analytical reports on economic analysis, economic re-generation, and human development; draft instruments for quick re-engagement between Government Development Partners when conditions warrant; notes on policy options developed through consultations with stakeholders.

iati-activity.title: Regional Innovation Support Programme for Southern Africa
iati-activity.description: The Regional Innovation Support Programme will support building economic and technology capacity in Southern Africa, particularly in Namibia, Mozambique, Botswana and South Africa. The overall objective of the programme is to increase employment in the Southern African region through a developed innovation capacity and innovation system to enhance sustainable and economic growth. The programme aims at creating lasting networks between existing innovation support systems, create best practices, remove duplication of costs and activities, increase higher-level political awareness and develop a regional platform of best-practice innovation systems development initiatives able to both leverage and mobilise triple-helix role-players in the region.

iati-activity.title: Creating Sustainable Businesses in the knowledge economy
iati-activity.description: Trust Fund is producing knowledge and good practice on how ICT is applied to the achievement of development goals, how enabling environment needs to be developed for implementation of applications and how public-private partnerships can be fostered to support entrepreneurship, growth and innovation.

iati-activity.title: Energy and Environment Partnership in Southern and East Africa
iati-activity.description: Energy and Environment Partnership in Southern and East Africa.

location.name: Botswana, Kenya, Mosambique, Namibia, South Africa, Swaziland, Tanzania, Zambia

iati-activity.title: Zimbabwe Education Trust Fund
iati-activity.description: UNICEF's Education Transition Fund (ETF) supports the reconstruction of Zimbabwean education system through capacity building and strengthening the basic education. The purpose of the ETF is to enhance the quality of education and bring down the number of drop outs by multiplying teaching materials. The fund also provides technical assistance to the Ministry of Education, Sport, Art and Culture to develop essential sectors of education. Finland's support is aimed to include Finnish technical assistance (through UNICEF or UNESCO) to support the Ministry in its strategic planning.

iati-activity.title: INGO Aid to Care Danmark Adaptation Learning Programme for Africa
iati-activity.description: CARE Denmark Adaptation Learning Programme for Africa operates in Niger, Ghana, Kenya and Mozambique. The objective is to strengthen the capacity of poor households to adapt to climate variability and change. The programme uses a community-based adaptation approach and it has special focus on women and vulnerable groups. Learning, application of collected information and spreading of the results are integral parts of the programme.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Support to the socially marginalised communities in the Southern Africa
iati-activity.description: African sovieties are challenged by serious problems i.e. shortage of food, health, unemployment, hiv/aids, ecological issues, instability, urbanuzation, violence and xenophobia. Activities are implemented through churches, whose role in African societies is central.They however lack competence and capacity to respond to these needs. The aim of this programme is to increase the capacities of the local partner organisations to become competent in responding to the challenges. The target groups of the pilot programme are the marginalised and most vulnerable members of the communities. Regional approach is needed because problems do not respect national borders. The activities can not be covered by CUAHA network, which is focusing on hiv/aids related issues and whose constituency is different from that of Lunodia.

iati-activity.title: EAC Lake Victoria Basin Commission Trust Fund
iati-activity.description: The Lake Victoria Basin Commission (LVBC) has invited the Government of Finland to join the LVBC partnership fund. The LVBC was established by the East African Community (EAC; members Burundi, Kenia, Ruanda, Tansania and Uganda) in 2005. The LVBC partnership fund is part of a partnership agreement signed in 2001 between the EAC and the Governments of Sweden, France and Norway, the World Bank and East African Development Bank. The overall objective of the fund is to promote sustainable development in the Lake Victoria Basin. The specific objective is to provide sources of funding for the identification and formulation of projects and activities; policy development and capacity building.
iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: Humanitarian Aid to support food Aid in-kind through WFP
iati-activity.description: Food Aid in-kind through WFP. Aid will be provided as rapeseed oil to Mauritania and Mali.

iati-activity.title: Catalyst for Social and Economic Change
iati-activity.description: The objective is to train the library personnel in Namibia and Tanzania in ICT and information search skills to enable them to teach the skills to the public. The purpose is to enable the libraries to extend the services of the information and knowledge down to the grassroot level, give tools for democratic participation and promote the economy.

iati-activity.title: The SADC Renewable Energy Support Programme
iati-activity.description: The purpose of the Project is to provide capacity building for the SADC Secretariat's Energy unit in form of assisting the Secretariat in preparing and implementing the Strategy on renewable energy in the SADC region. Finland will second a specialist on renewable energy to the SADC secretariat's Energy unit.

iati-activity.title: Regional partnership to promote trade and investment in sub-Sahara
iati-activity.description: The project is a regional partnership between the Government of Finland and the MDG Centres and ICFRA, the Millennium Cities Initiative (MCI) of the Earth Institute at Columbia University and the Vale Columbia Centre on Sustainable International Investment (VCC) to strengthen sub-national investment capacity in sub-Saharan Africa, particularly in Mekelle of Ethiopia, Kumasi in Ghana and Tabora in Tanzania. The project will (1) assist secondary cities/regions in generating more investment (both local and foreign), to build up their productive capacity and their ability to trade; this, in turn, will contribute to reaching the MDGs; and (2) contribute to global dialog on the importance of increasing sustainable investment and action at the subnational (cities/region) level.

iati-activity.title: Support to Magaliesberg initiative
iati-activity.description: The North West Provincial Department of Agriculture, Conservation, Environment and Rural Development in South Africa has initiated cooperation with the Finnish Environment Institute based on financing by the Institutional Co-operation Instrument (ICI) of the Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland concerning support to the Magaliesberg Biosphere Initiative. These are the project partners. The development objective of this ICI Project is to promote sustainable socio-economic and environmental development, cooperative governance, natural and cultural heritage protection and educational/ research opportunities for current and future generations by registering the Magaliesberg Biosphere Area with UNESCO Man and Biosphere Programme. The Project Purpose is capacity building for biosphere area application, establishment and management in the North West Province.

location.name: South Africa, North West province & Gauteng province

iati-activity.title: Impact of climate change in ecosystems in Eastern Africa
iati-activity.description: The project studies the impacts of climate change on East African biodiversity rich montane ecosystems, related ecosystem services and food security. It also enhaces the capacity of local actors related to information gathering and updating, as well as climate change adaptation. The project also aims at developing applicable adaptation strategies.

iati-activity.title: Addressing Sexual Violence through ICC Trust Fund for Victims
iati-activity.description: The programme "Addressing Sexual Violence as a Tactic of War â Rehabilitation and Supporting Survivors" is managed by the ICC Trust Fund for Victims. Funds for the programme are collected through voluntary contributions of states.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen LÃ¤hetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: Coordination of Development Cooperation. Development coordinator's expences in Southern Africa region: travel, office costs etc.

iati-activity.title: REG/Improving West-African Capacities in Mediation and Peace Process
iati-activity.description: The project aims to contribute to West-African capacity-building in conflict prevention through the creation of a training programme for multi-track mediation and conflict analysis targeting key decision-makers in the region. After the identification of stakeholders, peace-mediation professionals and civil society representatives are interviewed and filmed for training purposes. Workshops are organised for members of civil society and diplomats in order to share experiences and recommendations on work in peace processes. Thereafter a workshop for conflict analysis is organised in order to develop good practice and policy options. All information is gathered and used for the creation of the training programme. The pilot course will take 30 participants who will evaluate the course for its further development.

iati-activity.title: Business linkage programme (Finnpartnership)
iati-activity.description: Long term partnership with a local company / organisation (e.g. joint venture; subcontractor, import or other contract agreement )
